intro: Yinshania qianningensis var. brachybotrys, commonly known as the short-stemmed yinshania, is a rare plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its compact growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, and its leaves are finely divided and aromatic. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
